newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Softbank Expos sees $200 mln 1997 revenue.
newsitem.headline: Softbank Expos sees $200 mln 1997 revenue.

text.p: Softbank Exposition and Conference Company, a unit of Japan's Softbank Corp, expects its 1997 revenues to reach about US$200 million, president and chief executive officer William Lohse said on Tuesday.
Last year, revenues for Softbank Expos were about $150 million, Lohse said in an interview with Reuters.
Lohse, in Singapore for a business visit, declined to reveal profit figures.

"We are not number one in profits. There are other trade shows and companies that are more profitable than us," he said. He said one of the reasons is the high amount of investments the company puts into education programmes for its tradeshows.
Softbank will be bringing its Networld+Interop tradeshow and conference to Singapore in April. The conference will be led by independent experts in the networking and Internet industries.
Lohse said he saw potential for the Softbank group in Singapore which "positions itself as being a hub for regional information technology (IT) activities".
At the coming show in April, 90 percent of the exhibitors will be from abroad, mainly from the U.S.
Lohse said he expected about 12,000-15,000 IT professionals to attend the show in Singapore.
